channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024060138
item.description:
Report E-2024060138

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: HAHNVILLE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On Friday, May 17, 2024, a Occidental Chemical driver made a delivery of Hydrochloric acid to the Occidental Chemical plant located in Hahnville, LA. The Occidental Chemical driver was loaded at an IMTT facility located in Geismar, LA. While the unloading process was underway, it was discovered that the bleeder valve on the product transfer line that goes to the product storage tank was left open. This resulted in approximately 2600 gallons of Hydrochloric acid being released from the product line into the containment area. No injuries or exposure to chemical occurred as a result of this event, as well as no off-site impact or environmental impact. The offloading process was halted, bleeder valve closed, containment area drained to sump for processing, and remainder of offload was completed.

item.title: Report E-2024060049
item.description:
Report E-2024060049

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: FOUNTAIN
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DYNO NOBEL INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 400300
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The CTMV was travelling northeast on NC 222. The truck drove off the right side of the roadway, overcorrected, and then skidded across the center line and overturned onto its side. The CTMV rolled onto the passenger side of the vehicle across NC 222. During the rollover the force of impact caused the manway failure. Approximately 2,000 lbs. of emulsion spilled from the tank onto the ground. A hazardous materials contractor recovered the spilled emulsion and remediated the soil. The cost for the cleanup and remediation is still pending final notification from the contractor.

item.title: Report E-2024060008
item.description:
Report E-2024060008

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: BERLIN HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The driver notice liquid escaping from trailer on 4/29/2024 and he pulled over on the shoulder and proceeded to put down absorbents to create a dam preventing it from spreading further. He then called our emergency response number and 911 approximately 1825 CT. Local fire showed up and a container was put under the valve that was leaking. Federal, State, and Local EPS agency's were notified ant approximately 1845 CT We dispatched a team to the scene they arrived at approximately 2130 CT. They spoke with the local EPA that was on scene and then began clean up. The clean up was completed at approximately 1700 CT 4/30/2024.

item.title: Report X-2024051203
item.description:
Report X-2024051203

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: Manuelito
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 235000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: X-2024051203: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. NATX 400688 suffered jacket damage and some dents. The car suffered a 19"x2" heat-induced tear on the "B-end". This car was turned over in a pit and burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051204: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 952565 suffered jacket damage and some dents. After being exposed to flame impingement for hours, the tank suffered what appears to be a heat-induced tear measuring about 6"x1" on the top of the tank, underneath the jacket. The tank also had a significant blister at this point as well. Significant heat damage to protective housing as well. This car was turned over in a pit and burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051207: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 955642 suffered jacket damage and some dents. The tank suffered a puncture/tear toward the A-end of the car measuring about 2'x3'. This car was turned over in a pit and burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051208: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 954193 suffered jacket damage and some dents on each end, but no container failure. After being exposed to flame impingement for hours, all gaskets/o-rings were burnt out from valves under the protective housing and product burned from these orifices. The protective housing also had significant damage. This car had burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051209: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 959911 suffered jacket damage and some dents including a significant B-end head dent, but no container failure. After being exposed to flame impingement for hours, all gaskets/o-rings were burnt out from valves under the protective housing and product burned from these orifices. This car was turned over in a pit and burned itself out after consuming all remaining propane liquid. X-2024051210: H-BELPHX1-25A derailed containing six Propane cars that were involved in fire due to container breaches/damage. UTLX 953969 suffered jacket damage and some dents including a dent on each end, but no container failure. This car did have multiple PRD venting cycles due to being exposed to heat/fire for hours. This car was liquid flared and then vapor flared to remove all remaining product.
